description.narrative: Compliance of Uzbekistan with the accelerated Montreal Protocol HCFC phase-out requirements achieved through stabilization and progressive reduction of HCFC consumption
capital of a political entity

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: HPMP National Level Capacity Strengthening and HCFC Phase Out Investment
Demonstration of Endusers Grants for retrofits replacements

comment.narrative: Alternative technologies are not commonly used for retrofit of existing systems and are not field tested to facilitate practical introduction
Demonstrated benefits of up to date modern cooling equipment

The preliminary list of equipment for implementation of demo projects on retrofit is prepared
Meetings with potential partners on demo projects are conducted and few facilities identified for application of demo projects in Tajikistan
As a result a few social orphanage and nursing home and commercial structures were identified to install replacements The bidding process to identify potential partner to deliver replacement equipment is underway

description.narrative: Implementation of a solvent conversion project at David Gorodok Electromechanical Plant

comment.narrative: AtlantDavidGorodok solvent users depends on HCFC141b in manufacturing processes and this is a high emissive use of HCFCs
AtlantDavidGorodok technologically converted to nonODS technology HCFC141b to transblends based on HFCs closed loop cycle and minimization of agent use reduce emissions

During reporting period project made a market research on existing solventbased closedcycled with solvent recuperation washing unit ITB completed and contracts on supply of the equipment required for technological conversion to nonODS cleaning process at David Gorodok Electromechanical Plant were signed This was preceeded by a technical visit to the selected supplier in June 2015 near Istanbul Turkey on the margins of the regional project board meeting
Supply installation commissioning of the equipment as well as personnel training is scheduled for 3rd quarter of 2015 This will be accompanied by a final visit with inspection and safety audit from the assigned international expert Recommendations from safety audit will be submitted to DavidGorodok company
The choice of a solvent to replace curent HCFC use was Hladis ACX consisting of methylene chloride R30 and additives Since being subject to emission contorl standards related GOSTs on ventilation and ambient air GOST 124021 and 121005 will need to be followed It is understood that ventilation system was ready to be installed by DavidGorodok
AtlantDavidGorodok technologically converted to nonODS technology HCFC141b to transblends based on HFCs closed loop cycle and minimization of agent use reduce emissions

During reporting period project made a market research on existing solventbased closedcycled with solvent recuperation washing unit ITB completed and contracts on supply of the equipment required for technological conversion to nonODS cleaning process at David Gorodok Electromechanical Plant were signed This was preceeded by a technical visit to the selected supplier in June 2015 near Istanbul Turkey on the margins of the regional project board meeting
Supply installation commissioning of the equipment as well as personnel training is scheduled for 3rd quarter of 2015 This will be accompanied by a final visit with inspection and safety audit from the assigned international expert Recommendations from safety audit will be submitted to DavidGorodok company
The choice of a solvent to replace curent HCFC use was Hladis ACX consisting of methylene chloride R30 and additives Since being subject to emission contorl standards related GOSTs on ventilation and ambient air GOST 124021 and 121005 will need to be followed It is understood that ventilation system was ready to be installed by DavidGorodok

description.narrative: Pilot unwanted ODS Destruction Project

comment.narrative: Gradual accumulation of obsolete ODS waste unusable mixtures and emptied HCFC cylinders with ODS fractions and the acute need to dispose of such wastes
Smallscale obsolete ODS destruction capacity established on a pilot basis to reenforce the HCFC reuse system and a planned ban on single use containers

Analysis of the international market proposals for low capacity destruction units their cost effectiveness operational expenses are very high and the perspectives of introducing them into the national RRR scheme Government considers establishing a special chlorinated waste destruction technology that would then be able to accept waste ODS gases which area also chlorinated resulted in refusal of MNREP to acquire such kind of equipment and this led to cancellation of the international tender results Actual amount of registered waste is 300 kg which is small amount that does not justify establishing a unit like this
This issue was discussed at the project board in May 2015 and it was decided to reallocate these funds for implementation of pilot projects introducing nonODSlow GWP cooling technologies
The issue of the most effective way to utilize nonreusable HCFCs is still under consideration in the Government Since the geographical position of Belarus allows for export of such wastes to EUbased qualified hightemperature incinerators HTI this will be one of possibilities in future once ODS waste gas levels achieve larger manageable volumes
Smallscale obsolete ODS destruction capacity established on a pilot basis to reenforce the HCFC reuse system and a planned ban on single use containers

Analysis of the international market proposals for low capacity destruction units their cost effectiveness operational expenses are very high and the perspectives of introducing them into the national RRR scheme Government considers establishing a special chlorinated waste destruction technology that would then be able to accept waste ODS gases which area also chlorinated resulted in refusal of MNREP to acquire such kind of equipment and this led to cancellation of the international tender results Actual amount of registered waste is 300 kg which is small amount that does not justify establishing a unit like this
This issue was discussed at the project board in May 2015 and it was decided to reallocate these funds for implementation of pilot projects introducing nonODSlow GWP cooling technologies
The issue of the most effective way to utilize nonreusable HCFCs is still under consideration in the Government Since the geographical position of Belarus allows for export of such wastes to EUbased qualified hightemperature incinerators HTI this will be one of possibilities in future once ODS waste gas levels achieve larger manageable volumes

description.narrative: Upgrade of HCFC reuse system through strengthening RRR centers and improving local distribution of bulk HCFCHFCs in support of container import regulations

comment.narrative: HCFCs are not reused domestically lack of a comprehensive HCFC reuse system and country depends on imports
Regulatory measures to ban single use containers are effected and allow to create HCFC distribution system in country

Legislative provisions to ban importexport and use of nonrefillable containers were introduced in 2014 ref to the Law of the Republic of Belarus of June 16 2014 N 161W About Amendments and Addenda to certain Laws of the Republic of Belarus on the Ozone Layer Protection
This is seen as an important factor in future to help established incountry HCFC distribution system where chemicals in bulk are imported larger 500 kg or 1 ton capacity cylinders which are easy to check by Customs and the spread of singleuse cillynders which remain with unevacuated fractions of HCFCs and are considered waste would be gradually stopped
This also will provide additional business opportunities on HCFC distribution in the country and potentially in the region in longterm perspective if business takes off well and becomes a regional hub
Regulatory measures to ban single use containers are effected and allow to create HCFC distribution system in country

Legislative provisions to ban importexport and use of nonrefillable containers were introduced in 2014 ref to the Law of the Republic of Belarus of June 16 2014 N 161W About Amendments and Addenda to certain Laws of the Republic of Belarus on the Ozone Layer Protection
This is seen as an important factor in future to help established incountry HCFC distribution system where chemicals in bulk are imported larger 500 kg or 1 ton capacity cylinders which are easy to check by Customs and the spread of singleuse cillynders which remain with unevacuated fractions of HCFCs and are considered waste would be gradually stopped
This also will provide additional business opportunities on HCFC distribution in the country and potentially in the region in longterm perspective if business takes off well and becomes a regional hub

description.narrative: Upgrades of HCFC reuse system

comment.narrative: HCFCs are not reused domestically lack of a comprehensive HCFC reuse system and country depends on imports
HCFC reuse system upgraded through strengthening RRR centers across the country in strategic locations countrys technical capacity is improved

With the recruitment of project manager and inception workshop in September 2014 the project assessed national situation with current HCFC reuse system which includes ODS HCFCHFC recovery extraction from refrigeratonAC equipment and recylcingreclaim cleaning from acidsoilsimpurities storing gas identification and equipment repair tools Previous assistance in this sector in Uzbekistan was provided during beginning of 2000s and equipment supplied at that time was mostly out of order by the time new HCFC project became operational
Based on this review national consultations on selecting future HCFC reuse centers were held and technical plans of 5 HCFC recoveryrecycling RR and 1 HCFC reclaim centers across the country were prepared
RR centers will be established at existing refrigeration service companies Shomur Fergana region Hladmontaj Andijan region Yolreftrans Syrdarya region Holod System Tashkent city and Pachenko Navoi region
Reclaim center ODS reclamation is a special cleaning process that decreases the level of impurities in used ODS gas to less than 1 while recycling allows for 5 impurities should be established at premises of the State Inspection on Analytical Control under State Committee for Nature Protection
All these partners had provided cofinancing letters during project formulation Final list and technical specifications of equipment for recoveryrecyclingreclaim centers was finalized and procurement bidding initiated
As far as smaller servicing companies and individual technicans are concerned the project announced tenders for supply of basic HCFC recoveryequipment repair tools Overall 125 sets of such tools will be delivered to Uzbekistan in the second half of 2015 for distribution This will support the HCFC reuse network of RR and reclaim centers which in turn will provide ODS gas recuperation services to smaller service companies and enterpreneurs
HCFC reuse system upgraded through strengthening RRR centers across the country in strategic locations countrys technical capacity is improved

With the recruitment of project manager and inception workshop in September 2014 the project assessed national situation with current HCFC reuse system which includes ODS HCFCHFC recovery extraction from refrigeratonAC equipment and recylcingreclaim cleaning from acidsoilsimpurities storing gas identification and equipment repair tools Previous assistance in this sector in Uzbekistan was provided during beginning of 2000s and equipment supplied at that time was mostly out of order by the time new HCFC project became operational
Based on this review national consultations on selecting future HCFC reuse centers were held and technical plans of 5 HCFC recoveryrecycling RR and 1 HCFC reclaim centers across the country were prepared
RR centers will be established at existing refrigeration service companies Shomur Fergana region Hladmontaj Andijan region Yolreftrans Syrdarya region Holod System Tashkent city and Pachenko Navoi region
Reclaim center ODS reclamation is a special cleaning process that decreases the level of impurities in used ODS gas to less than 1 while recycling allows for 5 impurities should be established at premises of the State Inspection on Analytical Control under State Committee for Nature Protection
All these partners had provided cofinancing letters during project formulation Final list and technical specifications of equipment for recoveryrecyclingreclaim centers was finalized and procurement bidding initiated
As far as smaller servicing companies and individual technicans are concerned the project announced tenders for supply of basic HCFC recoveryequipment repair tools Overall 125 sets of such tools will be delivered to Uzbekistan in the second half of 2015 for distribution This will support the HCFC reuse network of RR and reclaim centers which in turn will provide ODS gas recuperation services to smaller service companies and enterpreneurs

description.narrative: Implementation of a foam conversion project at Intertehnika

comment.narrative: Intertehnika commercial refrigeration manufacturing depends on HCFC141b in its manufacturing processes either of domestic manufacture or import
Intertehnika technologically converted to nonODS low GWP technology HCFC141b based polyols to cpentane

The company is not accessible because it is situated in the area of armed conflict and changed ownership as reported by former focal companys focal points through the project manager Intertehnika was a part of the Nord Holding Group
Before these events the company reportedly selfconverted to the use of hydrocarbons when its production facility was relocated to main Nord facility where production process is based on hydrocabons no ozone depletion potential low GWP
This project partner is planned for removal from participation in the project which will be discussed and endorsed in a project board meeting in the second half of 2015
Contract with international foam expert expired and will not be resumed
Unused funding from this subcomponent will be applied in the second round of the programme revision towards assistance to the servicing sector
Next year reporting only will focus on confirmation of cancellation of this subcomponent

description.narrative: Trained and equipped working level Customs and enforcement officials and refrigeration technicians using resources trainers and training materials from Component 1 with respect to legislation regulations customs controls refrigeration servicing techniques and general best practices

comment.narrative: Key Government stakeholders as well as working level officials have limited awareness of HCFC phaseout issue challenges to address it and skillstools to enforce HCFC control measures in practice
Inclusion of HCFC control issues into curricula of Customs and enforcement officials training institutions

Belarus ODS import control issues were included into full time and distant educational programmes of the Customs Training Institute More than 400 customs officers were received training in ODS import control issues in 2014
New study curricula on ODS management was developed and adopted by National Training Center of the Minnature By 30 June 2015 over passed exams and received an advanced training and specialization certificate on HCFC control methods
Training programmes modules and educational materials on ODS management were developed for higher and secondary vocational schools involved into training of refrigeration technicians As of 20152016 academic year the issues on ODS management will be included into curricular of Minsk National Technical University Mogilev State University of Food Technologies and Polotsk Trade Technological College
Tajikistan In close collaboration with Refrigeration Association introductory sessions on the use of ODS equipment and other specialized equipment were carried out for 40 customs officers The GEFUNDP project has provided the Customs Agency with 23 necessary equipment on identification of ODS at the customs entry points Moreover the Customs Service has been equipped with ODS mobile laboratory
Ukraine Relations developed with State Fiscal Service Custom Primary order for training needs and equipment supply obtained from Custom Study visit of Customs representatives is scheduled for AugustSeptember 2015 to Belarus colleagues on different aspects of training and ODSdetecting equipment use
With Project provided support the Customs Risk Analysis Data Base expanded on the airconditioners ODScontaining equipment with refrigerant R22 Additional check of airconditioners is obligatory to avoid illegal import of ODScontaining equipment
On 2224 April 2015 the Project participated and contributed to the Annual Ecological Forum in Kiev where the Project advertised and presented among key counterparts governmental authorities NGOs and business
Further actions on agenda to assist in the participationpreparation of Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources representatives in the next ExCom in September 2015 and supply ODSdetecting equipment to the Custom
UzbekistanTraining curricula on customs officers issues related to new developments in the area of HCFC and HCFCbased equipment import control measuresprocedures for training 20 trainers from the State Customs Committee and for further training 300 customs and enforcement officials developed
Completion of training module on customs officers issues related to new developments in the area of HCFC and HCFCbased equipment import control measuresprocedures for training 300 customs and enforcement officials as well as conduction of training activities is expected to be implement in the next 20152016 reporting period
Inclusion of HCFC control issues into curricula of Customs and enforcement officials training institutions

description.narrative: Unwanted ODS Pilot Destruction Project

comment.narrative: Limited negative experience of obsolete ODS destruction in a lab setting and lack of emission controls at existing prototype lab equipment
Smallscale obsolete ODS destruction capacity established on a pilot basis

Based on market research technical specification to initiate bidding process for purchase of smallscale ODS waste destruction unit finalized and agreed withaccepted by the national partner Only one equipment manufacturer was identified and resulting analysisrequests for clarification from the manufacturer on application of similar units indicated high operational cost and raw material usage water electricity
In response to this national partner National Ozone Focal Point UNDPTashkent and project team reached an agreement with the Ministry of Ecology of China and will organize a study tour to Guangzhou province to familiarize the delegation with the results of ODS destruction project implemented during 20132014 years where such model of the ODS destruction unit with same specifications was in use The visit is to take place in the second half of 2015 to determine feasibility of sustaining this unit using cofinance resources
Further economic analysis of costeffectiveness of the equipment may trigger procurement and installation in case national partner agrees to purchase this ODS destruction unit
Smallscale obsolete ODS destruction capacity established on a pilot basis

Further economic analysis of costeffectiveness of the equipment may trigger procurement and installation in case national partner agrees to purchase this ODS destruction unit

description.narrative: Demonstration and replacement programme for the refrigeration sector

comment.narrative: Limited proliferation of alternatives to HCFCs in refrigerated equipment
NonODSlowzero GWP ammonia CO2 HCs technologies in the servicing sector demonstrated and promoted

Needs assessment on application of alternative and energy efficient nonODSlowzero GWP ammonia CO2 HCs technologies conducted
Announcement of national contest of project proposals for implementation of demonstration projects initiated and call for proposal was placed in local mass media
As a result six 6 project proposals from HCFC users and refrigeration equipment manufacturers collected and evaluation is underway
Implementation of demonstration projects expected to start in the next 20152016 reporting period
NonODSlowzero GWP ammonia CO2 HCs technologies in the servicing sector demonstrated and promoted

Needs assessment on application of alternative and energy efficient nonODSlowzero GWP ammonia CO2 HCs technologies conducted
Announcement of national contest of project proposals for implementation of demonstration projects initiated and call for proposal was placed in local mass media
As a result six 6 project proposals from HCFC users and refrigeration equipment manufacturers collected and evaluation is underway
Implementation of demonstration projects expected to start in the next 20152016 reporting period

description.narrative: Demonstration of benefits for natural cooling

comment.narrative: Limited proliferation of alternatives to HCFCs in refrigerated equipment
Natural cooling lowzero ODSlowzero GWP technologies in the servicing sector demonstrated and promoted

The bidding process to procure and deliver equipment for application of natural cooling technologies was initiated and potential national company was contracted by the project 15 packages with natural cooling technology will be purchased in 20152016 and installed for demonstration and effectiveness monitoring If succesful energyefficiency gains are possible and this project can be replicated elswhere
During the reporting period after technical research and negotiations with the private sector the project team conducted number of meetings with cellular companies such as Babilonmobile TCell and Megafone to start arrangements with implementation of demo projects on natural cooling As a result cofinancing letters from the companies to provide their facilities for demo projects were received
It is expected to start demonstration projects at the end of 2015
Natural cooling lowzero ODSlowzero GWP technologies in the servicing sector demonstrated and promoted

The bidding process to procure and deliver equipment for application of natural cooling technologies was initiated and potential national company was contracted by the project 15 packages with natural cooling technology will be purchased in 20152016 and installed for demonstration and effectiveness monitoring If succesful energyefficiency gains are possible and this project can be replicated elswhere
During the reporting period after technical research and negotiations with the private sector the project team conducted number of meetings with cellular companies such as Babilonmobile TCell and Megafone to start arrangements with implementation of demo projects on natural cooling As a result cofinancing letters from the companies to provide their facilities for demo projects were received
It is expected to start demonstration projects at the end of 2015

description.narrative: Demonstration of benefits of natural cooling in one or two sectors such as agricultural milk coolers

comment.narrative: Limited proliferation of low GWP alternatives NH3 CO2 double stage HCs etc to HCFCs in refrigerated equipment
NonODSlowzero GWP NH3 CO2 double stage HCs etc technologies in the servicing sector demonstrated and promoted through awareness raising

National experts conducted analysis of the internationally recognized advanced cooling technologies As a result three directions for introducing nonODSlow GWP technologies ammonia NH3 carbon dioxide CO2 propane R290 were considered to be the most prospective ones for the economy of Belarus
Information on prospects for use climatefriendly technologies in cold industry was published in the specialized magazine for refrigeration sector Microclimate and cold
The pilot project to demonstrate the advantages of using natural refrigerant ammonia in modern airconditioning systems has been started Implementation of this demonstration project will benefit country by providing assistance to pilot assembly of new ammonia NH3 refrigeration systems
NonODSlowzero GWP NH3 CO2 double stage HCs etc technologies in the servicing sector demonstrated and promoted through awareness raising

National experts conducted analysis of the internationally recognized advanced cooling technologies As a result three directions for introducing nonODSlow GWP technologies ammonia NH3 carbon dioxide CO2 propane R290 were considered to be the most prospective ones for the economy of Belarus
Information on prospects for use climatefriendly technologies in cold industry was published in the specialized magazine for refrigeration sector Microclimate and cold
The pilot project to demonstrate the advantages of using natural refrigerant ammonia in modern airconditioning systems has been started Implementation of this demonstration project will benefit country by providing assistance to pilot assembly of new ammonia NH3 refrigeration systems

description.narrative: Information exchange platform on HCFC substitute technologies for ineligible foam manufacturers PU and XPS companies

comment.narrative: Low level of awareness related to HCFC phaseout across stakeholders from manufacturing sector
Main stakeholders in the manufacturing sector are informed about new and emerging alternative technologies and various capitaloperating investment aspects

HCFC data collection after initial delay is being launched by the project team and this will help design draft national HCFC phaseout strategy The data collection covers also foam enterprises PU XPS and system houses to understand changes in the original projects baseline
Based on this activity project team will plan such information exchange in the foam sector once all actors have been fully identified
Activity planned for future reporting cycles
Main stakeholders in the manufacturing sector are informed about new and emerging alternative technologies and various capitaloperating investment aspects

HCFC data collection after initial delay is being launched by the project team and this will help design draft national HCFC phaseout strategy The data collection covers also foam enterprises PU XPS and system houses to understand changes in the original projects baseline
Based on this activity project team will plan such information exchange in the foam sector once all actors have been fully identified
Activity planned for future reporting cycles

description.narrative: Implementation of a foam conversion project at MAZ Kupava

comment.narrative: MAZKupava foam product manufacturer depends on HCFC141b in manufacturing processes
MAZKupava technologically converted to nonODS low GWP technology HCFC141b based polyols to cpentane

Based on additional consultations with MAZKupava project team and international expert it was decided to agree to have one consolidated ITB for both foaming and press with mold lines whereas MAZKupava would be responsible to cover excess costs above GEF budget for this subcomponent
During bidding it was discovered that the foaming line costs from EU based providers with regional service representation CannonAfros exceeded the GEF budget and project team had long negotiations with MAZKupava to agree on cofunding this extra cost
MAZKupava upon agreement applied to special Governmental funds for additional support to ensure the companys PU line is fully modernized Decision to fund MAZKupava was cleared end of June 2015
UNDPled consolidated tender both lines were a part of one ITB to ensure compatibility then triggered assembly of both lines with delivery installation and commissioning of the equipment scheduled for Q1 2016 MAZKupava will directly release extra funding to CannonAfros in the second half of 2015 when funds from the Government are in place
Delay in implementing this pilot caused by difficult financial situation occurred in the country in the end of 2014 and as a result funding gap of MAZ Kupava to fulfill its obligations for procurement the remaining part of nonODSlow GWP technological line
MAZKupava technologically converted to nonODS low GWP technology HCFC141b based polyols to cpentane

Based on additional consultations with MAZKupava project team and international expert it was decided to agree to have one consolidated ITB for both foaming and press with mold lines whereas MAZKupava would be responsible to cover excess costs above GEF budget for this subcomponent
During bidding it was discovered that the foaming line costs from EU based providers with regional service representation CannonAfros exceeded the GEF budget and project team had long negotiations with MAZKupava to agree on cofunding this extra cost
MAZKupava upon agreement applied to special Governmental funds for additional support to ensure the companys PU line is fully modernized Decision to fund MAZKupava was cleared end of June 2015
UNDPled consolidated tender both lines were a part of one ITB to ensure compatibility then triggered assembly of both lines with delivery installation and commissioning of the equipment scheduled for Q1 2016 MAZKupava will directly release extra funding to CannonAfros in the second half of 2015 when funds from the Government are in place
Delay in implementing this pilot caused by difficult financial situation occurred in the country in the end of 2014 and as a result funding gap of MAZ Kupava to fulfill its obligations for procurement the remaining part of nonODSlow GWP technological line

description.narrative: Formal HCFC Phaseout strategy and action plan developed and endorsed

comment.narrative: No formal HCFC strategy is adopted and enforced through regulatory measures
HCFC phaseout strategy fully formulated packaged as draft legislation for Government approval and cleared by line Ministriesdepartments for final endorsement

Belarus HCFC phaseout strategy is fully formulated cleared by line Ministries departments adopted and endorsed by the Government 13032013
Tajikistan The Committee on Environmental Protection has developed an action plan based on the newly developed HCFC phaseout legislation package Currently the newly HCFC legislation is submitted to the Government for endorsement
Ukraine HCFC data collection has resumed in the reporting period National HCFC Draft Strategy will be formulated on the basis of such data and presented to the Government Recommendations for improving HCFC licensing and quota system and draft Ozone legislation developed but not passed the official procedures of adoption due from political instability and management changes in MENR of Ukraine
Uzbekistan Overall Country Programme on ODS phaseout has been in place since 2002 covering HCFC phaseout in general However new regulatory measures on better control of exportimport of HCFC and equipment containing HCFC were developed discussed with national partners and submitted by the State Committee for Nature Protection to the Governments consideration through organization of national level round table meeting devoted to national and international HCFC phaseout importexport legislation
HCFC phaseout strategy fully formulated packaged as draft legislation for Government approval and cleared by line Ministriesdepartments for final endorsement

Belarus HCFC phaseout strategy is fully formulated cleared by line Ministries departments adopted and endorsed by the Government 13032013
Tajikistan The Committee on Environmental Protection has developed an action plan based on the newly developed HCFC phaseout legislation package Currently the newly HCFC legislation is submitted to the Government for endorsement
Ukraine HCFC data collection has resumed in the reporting period National HCFC Draft Strategy will be formulated on the basis of such data and presented to the Government Recommendations for improving HCFC licensing and quota system and draft Ozone legislation developed but not passed the official procedures of adoption due from political instability and management changes in MENR of Ukraine
Uzbekistan Overall Country Programme on ODS phaseout has been in place since 2002 covering HCFC phaseout in general However new regulatory measures on better control of exportimport of HCFC and equipment containing HCFC were developed discussed with national partners and submitted by the State Committee for Nature Protection to the Governments consideration through organization of national level round table meeting devoted to national and international HCFC phaseout importexport legislation

description.narrative: Implementation of a system house conversion project at Polyfoam

comment.narrative: Polyfoam system house and its downstream users continue to depend on HCFC141b in polyol blending and consumption
Polyfoam and its downstream users are technologically converted to nonODS low GWP technology methyl formate

During reporting period Polifoam city of Dneprodzerjinsk stayed as the only financially viable and accessible company left in the manufacturing sector in the project
The project arranged for a SouthSouth study tour to a Brazilbased System House of Purcom in March 2015 The reason for the visit was the need to confirm methyl formate MF blends chemical composition and infrastructure at Purcom being one of the advanced system houses globally with MF introduced Polyfoam brought samples of MF blend for direct use in its laboratory and then trial production which did not perform well in certain applications such as for refrigeration manufacturing low density
Previously recruited international foam expert refused to continue with this assignment by referring to ongoing military conflict in the country In response a special visit was arranged by one of UNDP lead foam experts in May 2015 to identify issues with MF trials at Polifoam and subsequently revisions were proposed to Polifoam project document design and its budget upward but within existing donor funding rules to match it better to the needs on the ground
New TORrecruitment process is underway to identify a suitable foam expert to continue providing assistance to Polifoam
Revisions in the Polifoam subcomponent are planned for official approval by a project board in the second half of 2015 Implementation of the revised project can start in OctoberNovember 2015
Direct contractual modality for implementation of Polifoam project has been proposed based on successful experience in Brazil
Polyfoam and its downstream users are technologically converted to nonODS low GWP technology methyl formate

During reporting period Polifoam city of Dneprodzerjinsk stayed as the only financially viable and accessible company left in the manufacturing sector in the project
The project arranged for a SouthSouth study tour to a Brazilbased System House of Purcom in March 2015 The reason for the visit was the need to confirm methyl formate MF blends chemical composition and infrastructure at Purcom being one of the advanced system houses globally with MF introduced Polyfoam brought samples of MF blend for direct use in its laboratory and then trial production which did not perform well in certain applications such as for refrigeration manufacturing low density
Previously recruited international foam expert refused to continue with this assignment by referring to ongoing military conflict in the country In response a special visit was arranged by one of UNDP lead foam experts in May 2015 to identify issues with MF trials at Polifoam and subsequently revisions were proposed to Polifoam project document design and its budget upward but within existing donor funding rules to match it better to the needs on the ground
New TORrecruitment process is underway to identify a suitable foam expert to continue providing assistance to Polifoam
Revisions in the Polifoam subcomponent are planned for official approval by a project board in the second half of 2015 Implementation of the revised project can start in OctoberNovember 2015
Direct contractual modality for implementation of Polifoam project has been proposed based on successful experience in Brazil

description.narrative: Implementation of a foam conversion project at Sobraniye

comment.narrative: Sobraniye XPS foam product manufacturer depends on HCFCs R22 and sporadically 141b in its manufacturing processes
Sobraniye technologically converted to nonODS low GWP technology to carbon dioxide technology

The company is bankrupted due to the overall financial situation in the country developed with political instability and military activities
The reason for stopping economic activities at this company was related to increase in the cost of raw materials Input resource material XPS pellets which is used in the manufacturing of XPS plank 10 mm or other sized insulation sheets was in abundant supply before 20142015 based on taxreduced imports from the Russian Federation When economic ties with the Russian Federation started to deteriorate the supply of pellets gradually stopped New imports of the raw material was possible from China but with added VAT and import taxes which increased the cost of marketed products to a level of not being able to compete with imported ready XPS plank from other countries mostly EU
No any additional activities planned for this company and unused funding is planned for redistribution to the servicing sector
This decision will be taken at a project board meeting in the second half of 2015
Sobraniye technologically converted to nonODS low GWP technology to carbon dioxide technology

The company is bankrupted due to the overall financial situation in the country developed with political instability and military activities
The reason for stopping economic activities at this company was related to increase in the cost of raw materials Input resource material XPS pellets which is used in the manufacturing of XPS plank 10 mm or other sized insulation sheets was in abundant supply before 20142015 based on taxreduced imports from the Russian Federation When economic ties with the Russian Federation started to deteriorate the supply of pellets gradually stopped New imports of the raw material was possible from China but with added VAT and import taxes which increased the cost of marketed products to a level of not being able to compete with imported ready XPS plank from other countries mostly EU
No any additional activities planned for this company and unused funding is planned for redistribution to the servicing sector
This decision will be taken at a project board meeting in the second half of 2015

description.narrative: Technical Assistance AZN Techno

comment.narrative: The only organized and economically stable refrigerated equipment manufacturer in country depends on HCFCs in manufacturing processes
AZN Techno technologically converted to nonODS technologies HCFC141b polyols to waterbased technology and HCFC22 to HFCs for commercial refrigeration equipment

With recruitment of project manager in July 2014 and inception workshop in September 2014 joint plan of cooperation between the project and company AZN Techno was developed
As stated planned at the project formulation stage AZN Techno foaming technology used in insulation of commercial refrigeration stands was converted from use of HCFC141b to waterbased nonODS nonGWP solutions with guidance from its poliol supplier based in the Russian Federation Vladipur system house Company invested approximately US 92000 for this activity
As AZN Techno also uses HCFC22 for charging its commercial trade equipment the project has assisted the company with purchase of HFC404a charging station this refrigerant blend being used in commercial sector to replace the current use of HCFC22 Additional thermal imaging equipment was procured and supplied to AZN to help with leakproofing manufactured products
Additional consultations are planned with the company to continue to help with complementary equipmenttraining to ensure sustainability of current assistance round
AZN Techno technologically converted to nonODS technologies HCFC141b polyols to waterbased technology and HCFC22 to HFCs for commercial refrigeration equipment

With recruitment of project manager in July 2014 and inception workshop in September 2014 joint plan of cooperation between the project and company AZN Techno was developed
As stated planned at the project formulation stage AZN Techno foaming technology used in insulation of commercial refrigeration stands was converted from use of HCFC141b to waterbased nonODS nonGWP solutions with guidance from its poliol supplier based in the Russian Federation Vladipur system house Company invested approximately US 92000 for this activity
As AZN Techno also uses HCFC22 for charging its commercial trade equipment the project has assisted the company with purchase of HFC404a charging station this refrigerant blend being used in commercial sector to replace the current use of HCFC22 Additional thermal imaging equipment was procured and supplied to AZN to help with leakproofing manufactured products
Additional consultations are planned with the company to continue to help with complementary equipmenttraining to ensure sustainability of current assistance round

description.narrative: Railway Freezer Retrofit project for refrigerated transport sector Yolreftrans

comment.narrative: Weak basic servicing tooling of staff responsible for maintenance of the fleet and high refrigerant emissions due to transport and use specifics
Fleet retrofit at Yolreftrans enterprise implemented and sustained during and beyond project duration

With the project start after the inception workshop in September 2014 the needs of JSC Yolreftrans were assessed and in response technical specifications of required equipment tools and consumable goods were finalized in consulation with the stakeholder in order to prepare the company to launch the retrofits of its refrigeration railway fleet to nonODS HCFC and some cases residual CFC alternatives
The following equipment was purchased and delivered to JSC Yolreftrans one 1 set of industrial type flushing system Czech Ecotez produce to enable cleaning of refrigeration circuits from remaining mineral oil used with HCFCs before retrofits flushing agent 160 kg limited stock of substitute gas HFC134a 2 tons and synthetic oils 11 tons miscible with HFCs Though HFC134a is featured by 1430 GWP factor the replaced HCFC22 has a factor of 1810 in terms of GWP and certain reductions in GWP effect can be demonstrated as a sideeffect of the project The need for singlecomponent gas such as HFC134a in this initiative was justified in the project document since mobile railway transport with frequent vibrations of wagons and their refrigeration equipment results in frequent leaks and require quick maitenance with easytouse refrigerants and other alternatives based on lower GWPs such as natural refrigerants are not well established and new HFOs development of HFCs with very low GWP are too expensive at this moment due to starting production only in USA and not available on Uzbekistan market
Project team plans for close regular consultations with JSC Yolreftrans on retrofit programme to establish appropriate trackable indicators of proress
Further information will be provided in future reporting periods
Fleet retrofit at Yolreftrans enterprise implemented and sustained during and beyond project duration

With the project start after the inception workshop in September 2014 the needs of JSC Yolreftrans were assessed and in response technical specifications of required equipment tools and consumable goods were finalized in consulation with the stakeholder in order to prepare the company to launch the retrofits of its refrigeration railway fleet to nonODS HCFC and some cases residual CFC alternatives
The following equipment was purchased and delivered to JSC Yolreftrans one 1 set of industrial type flushing system Czech Ecotez produce to enable cleaning of refrigeration circuits from remaining mineral oil used with HCFCs before retrofits flushing agent 160 kg limited stock of substitute gas HFC134a 2 tons and synthetic oils 11 tons miscible with HFCs Though HFC134a is featured by 1430 GWP factor the replaced HCFC22 has a factor of 1810 in terms of GWP and certain reductions in GWP effect can be demonstrated as a sideeffect of the project The need for singlecomponent gas such as HFC134a in this initiative was justified in the project document since mobile railway transport with frequent vibrations of wagons and their refrigeration equipment results in frequent leaks and require quick maitenance with easytouse refrigerants and other alternatives based on lower GWPs such as natural refrigerants are not well established and new HFOs development of HFCs with very low GWP are too expensive at this moment due to starting production only in USA and not available on Uzbekistan market
Project team plans for close regular consultations with JSC Yolreftrans on retrofit programme to establish appropriate trackable indicators of proress
Further information will be provided in future reporting periods

description.narrative: Legislative and Policy Options for HCFC phaseout and control
Awareness training for decisionmakers on legislative and regulatory actions accomplished

comment.narrative: Decisionmakers from enforcement department Environment Protection Customs have limited knowledge and lack practical skills on the regulatory approaches to effectively control HCFC related challenges

Highlevel decisionmakers of Environment Protection Customs territorial inspectorates other Governmental agencies such as Ministry of Education Standardization Committee are well informed and support the objectives of HCFC consumption phaseout and measures to address this process

Information and experience exchange with other countries in the region and among the target group of countries continued in the reporting period Delegations from these countries attended thematic meetings of Ozone Officers organized by UNEP DTIE in Tajikistan October 2014 Belarus 2015 Armenia May 2015 and in the regional meeting of the current GEFHCFC project held in Turkey in June 2015
Technical personnel from servicing centers in Belarus and Tajikistan participated in refrigeration technology EXPOs in Germany 2014 and China 2015 respectively by enriching national knowledge and future capacity with current technological developments of direct application in the refrigeratoin and airconditioning sectors including on new ODSfreelow GWP technologies
Further bilateral visits from more advanced countries of the group were planned based on special decisionof the regional project board in June 2015 to assist Ukraine with understanding better national project design amd progress achieved in other countries and adapting this experience directly in Ukraine to facilitate implementation of the programme
All 4 HCFC regulatory instruments were assessed by an international consultant with a view to make sure international expertise benefits to each of the participating countries in their HCFC legislation review and that effective implementation is ensured The following missions have been conducted as part of the international consultants contract cumulative numbers
o 2 missions to Tajikistan
o 2 missions to Belarus
o 2 missions to Ukraine
o 1 mission to Uzbekistan second one planned for September 2015
Each mission was followed by a detailed mission report indicating the recommendations after the 1st mission in a country and analysis of whether the recommendations were taken up during the second mission to a country and highlighting remaining tasks
Awarenessraising of policymakers has been conducted through targeted missions of the international consultant on HCFC legislation in support of the activities conducted by the national teams on a daily basis with partner Ministries

description.narrative: Russian language resource materials on HCFC control options prepared

comment.narrative: Key stakeholders generally have limited awareness of the issue or actions required on the higher or technical level to address HCFC phaseout

Availability of key guidance documentation in Russian or local languages where required on HCFC control options Customs enforcement approaches and methodologies refrigeration sector capacity building energyefficiency ODS destruction etc

All relevant publications developed by UNEP as reference materials on Legislation and Policy Options for HCFC phaseout have been reviewed and adapted to the needs of the NonArticle 5 Countries participating in the project The reviewed texts have been completed as part of the International Consultants tasks and are to be translated

Availability of key guidance documentation in Russian or local languages where required on HCFC control options Customs enforcement approaches and methodologies refrigeration sector capacity building energyefficiency ODS destruction etc

All relevant publications developed by UNEP as reference materials on Legislation and Policy Options for HCFC phaseout have been reviewed and adapted to the needs of the NonArticle 5 Countries participating in the project The reviewed texts have been completed as part of the International Consultants tasks and are to be translated

description.narrative: Regional networking on the country with Art 5 and other non Art 5 countries in the region is supported

comment.narrative: Limited number or lack of trained trainers on enforcement and best refrigeration aspects
Training of a selected number of trainers on the technical level Customs controls and refrigeration practices is complete on regional level to initiate trainings on national level

Based on the regional level training of trainers for Customs held in 2014 in Bosnia and Herzegovina national level trainings were then supported in Belarus 400 officers and Tajikistan 40 officers during the reporting period
Uzbekistan requested additional Customs training incountry which was subsequently planned for September 2015 with help of assigned international expert on HCFC regulatory framework review
As concerns Ukraine due to continuing institutional changes project team was able to agree on cooperation with Customs office only by end of the current reporting period A bilateral mission was then planned from CustomsUkraine to CustomsBelarus to exchange experience and design support to CustomsUkraine in the most suitable manner to address current needs Currently procurement of HCFC gas analytical equipment is initiated by direct procurement based on Belaruss procurement case Training of Customs officers will be planned in Ukraine during next reporting period by a separate subcontract with qualified international trainers
Training of a selected number of trainers on the technical level Customs controls and refrigeration practices is complete on regional level to initiate trainings on national level

Based on the regional level training of trainers for Customs held in 2014 in Bosnia and Herzegovina national level trainings were then supported in Belarus 400 officers and Tajikistan 40 officers during the reporting period
Uzbekistan requested additional Customs training incountry which was subsequently planned for September 2015 with help of assigned international expert on HCFC regulatory framework review
As concerns Ukraine due to continuing institutional changes project team was able to agree on cooperation with Customs office only by end of the current reporting period A bilateral mission was then planned from CustomsUkraine to CustomsBelarus to exchange experience and design support to CustomsUkraine in the most suitable manner to address current needs Currently procurement of HCFC gas analytical equipment is initiated by direct procurement based on Belaruss procurement case Training of Customs officers will be planned in Ukraine during next reporting period by a separate subcontract with qualified international trainers

description.narrative: Monitoring learning adaptive feedback outreach and evaluation
ME and adaptive management applied to project in response to needs midterm evaluation findings with lessons learned extracted

comment.narrative: No Monitoring and Evaluation system
Monitoring and Evaluation system developed during year 1

Project monitoring was conducted in accordance with Monintoring and Evaluation Plan
Progress quarterly semester and annual reports on the project implementation were duly prepared
Detailed workplans and project budgets were prepared reviewedrevised and updated in due time in response to the identified changes in current needs and requirements
Evaluation framework was discussed with partner countries during the project review meeting in Istanbul in June 2015 in UNDP Regional Office The midterm evaluation of the projects in all four 4 countries and the regional component will be managed by the regional center one recruitment process for one evaluation expert with combined financial resources coming from all respective projects and will take place in OctoberNovember 2015
Monitoring and Evaluation system developed during year 1

Project monitoring was conducted in accordance with Monintoring and Evaluation Plan
Progress quarterly semester and annual reports on the project implementation were duly prepared
Detailed workplans and project budgets were prepared reviewedrevised and updated in due time in response to the identified changes in current needs and requirements
Evaluation framework was discussed with partner countries during the project review meeting in Istanbul in June 2015 in UNDP Regional Office The midterm evaluation of the projects in all four 4 countries and the regional component will be managed by the regional center one recruitment process for one evaluation expert with combined financial resources coming from all respective projects and will take place in OctoberNovember 2015

description.narrative: To achieve compliance with the accelerated Montreal Protocol HCFC phaseout requirements through stabilization and progressive reduction of HCFC consumption

Participating country except Ukraine which will request separate assistance in servicing sector is in compliance with the MP obligations for 2015 and 2020 or accelerates the phaseout earlier than MP requirements are enforced

comment.narrative: Lack of approved HCFC phaseout strategy
HCFC phaseout strategy fully formulated and recommended for adoption and implementation

As per the data publicly reported to the Ozone secretariat which is analysed by the Implementation Committee Meeting of the Montreal Protocol and later on confirmed by the Parties at their annual Meeting held in November 2014 in Paris all 4 participating countries are in compliance with their obligations under the Montreal Protocol for the latest HCFC national consumption data please see httpozoneuneporgenods_data_access_centre
One country Ukraine continues to implement a specific plan of action to be followed to maintain compliance which is also regularly discussed and reviewed by the Implementation Committee for the Montreal Protocol Details of the Ukrainian national situation are discussed below in the national components description to avoid duplication
All countries are on track to meet the 2015 target of 90 reduction of HCFC consumption compared to their baseline Ukraine reported decreasing HCFC imports trends which may help stay in compliance with 2015 targets this reporting will be released only in Q3 2016
The process of HCFC phaseout national strategy revision has been either accomplished in process or initiated in all 4 countries
Belarus HCFC Phaseout Strategy document is approved by the Council of Ministers It is disseminated among the ministries governmental entities and regional administrations It is also published at the MNREP website and publicly available
MNREP site
httpwwwminprirodagovbyennew_url_1818395897en
Ozone Layer Laws new edition is adopted The law includes certain statements on HCFC management regulation and control measures strongly supported by the project stakeholders eg ban on disposable cylinders for HCFC storing and transportation starting from 2016
Tajikistan During the reporting period the project contributed to the development and adoption of a new legislation including National HCFC phaseout strategy for the period of 2015 2020 It simultaneously provided assistance to the development of a number of normative regulatory documents Regulations on importexport of ozone depleting substances ODS Instructions on allocation of quota for HCFC import to support the legislation and their submission to key governmental stakeholders for review and further approval The draft HCFC phaseout strategy is under consideration of the Government for review and endorsement
Ukraine Political instability with insititutional changes continued to occur New national Ozone Focal Point was nominated to work with the GEFUNDP project Two 2 missions from legal review and HCFC strategy formulation internationale experts were fielded in May and June 2015 emphasizing the need for Governmental commitment over the HCFC control
Uzbekistan Overarching National Programme on Phaseout of ozonedepleting substances ODS was developed in 1999 and in 2000 it was adopted by the Resolution of the Cabinet of Ministers 20 More specifically in relation to improvements in HCFC legislation new regulatory measures to better control of exportimport of HCFC and equipment containing HCFC developed discussed with national partners and submitted by the State Committee for Nature Protection for consideration through organization of national level round table meeting devoted to national and international HCFC phaseout importexport legislation Government officials including representatives from the State Committee for Nature Protection Ministry of Finance Ministry of Justice State Customs Committee and other interested national partners involved in discussion of current ODS related regulations and new regulatory measures to be adopted in Uzbekistan A draft Road Map is planned for development to increase the effectiveness of national legislation related to the HCFC phaseout acceleration
HCFC phaseout strategy fully formulated and recommended for adoption and implementation

Uzbekistan Overarching National Programme on Phaseout of ozonedepleting substances ODS was developed in 1999 and in 2000 it was adopted by the Resolution of the Cabinet of Ministers 20 More specifically in relation to improvements in HCFC legislation new regulatory measures to better control of exportimport of HCFC and equipment containing HCFC developed discussed with national partners and submitted by the State Committee for Nature Protection for consideration through organization of national level round table meeting devoted to national and international HCFC phaseout importexport legislation Government officials including representatives from the State Committee for Nature Protection Ministry of Finance Ministry of Justice State Customs Committee and other interested national partners involved in discussion of current ODS related regulations and new regulatory measures to be adopted in Uzbekistan A draft Road Map is planned for development to increase the effectiveness of national legislation related to the HCFC phaseout acceleration
